key_points: A shooting at Michigan's Oxford High School left four students dead and six students plus a teacher wounded.
The 15-year-old suspect, Ethan Crumbley, is in custody and has been charged as an adult with multiple counts.
Crumbley's parents have been charged with involuntary manslaughter and were arrested after being considered fugitives.
This was the deadliest US school shooting since the May 2018 incident at Texas' Santa Fe High School.
Law enforcement had the suspect in custody within three minutes of arrival; he surrendered without firing at police.
The weapon used was a 9 mm Sig Sauer pistol bought by the suspect's father shortly before the shootings.
Two teachers reported concerning behavior by Crumbley close to the shooting date, leading to two meetings with him, including one with his parents just hours before the attack.
Investigators have found evidence including videos and a journal indicating Crumbley's intent to shoot up the school.
No other weapons were involved, and there's no indication the suspect wore body armor.
Prosecutors and law enforcement detail a chilling account of the shooting, describing it as 'methodical' and 'cold-hearted.'
